choices.text:
what are the catagories of figures of speech?
The following categories of figures of speech include:
1. Metaphors (such as "the apple fell far from the tree") 
2. Similes (comparing two things, such as a beautiful painting to an ugly duckling) 
3. Anaphora (repeating words or phrases at the beginning of sentences for emphasis) 
4. Antonymy (using opposite terms in parallelism) 
5. Hyperbole (making exaggerated statements that are not literally true but serve to emphasize meaning)
